intro: Oxyspora hispida, commonly known as the rough oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Oxyspora hispida is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and resilience.
